Container.Name: FileZilla
Container.Overview:
FileZilla is a cross-platform graphical FTP, SFTP, and FTPS file management tool with a vast list of features.
The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client.
Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size).
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-filezilla/blob/master/README.md
Container.Description:
FileZilla is a cross-platform graphical FTP, SFTP, and FTPS file management tool with a vast list of features.
The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client.
Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size).
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-filezilla/blob/master/README.md.
Container.Changes:
###v1.35.4 (2022-07-24) - Updated FileZilla to version 3.60.2 and libfilezilla to version 0.38.1.
###v1.35.3 (2022-06-25) - Fixed issue where transfers using sftp would fail on devices running older kernel.
###v1.35.2 (2022-06-02) - Updated FileZilla to version 3.60.1.
###v1.35.1 (2022-05-30) - Updated FileZilla to version 3.60.0. - Updated libfilezilla 0.37.2.
###v1.35.0 (2022-04-12) - Updated FileZilla to version 3.59.0 and libfilezilla to version 0.37.1.
###v1.34.0 (2022-02-15) - Updated FileZilla to version 3.58.0. - Updated libfilezilla to version 0.36.0.
###v1.33.0 (2021-12-30) - Updated FileZilla to version 3.57.0. - Updated libfilezilla to version 0.35.0. - Now using baseimage version 3.5.8, based on Alpine 3.15, which brings the following change: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes.

###v1.28.0 (2020-10-23) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.51.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.25.0.

###v1.26.0 (2020-07-19) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.49.1 - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.23.0. - Now using baseimage v3.5.5, based on Alpine 3.12, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded glibc to version 2.31 on Alpine Linux images with glibc integrated. - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Adjusted the log monitor target for recent versions of YAD.

###v1.23.1 (2020-03-15) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.47.2.1. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.20.2.
###v1.23.0 (2020-03-08) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.47.1. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.20.1.
###v1.22.1 (2019-12-25) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.46.3. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.19.3.
###v1.22.0 (2019-12-02) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.46.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.19.1.
###v1.21.1 (2019-09-25) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.45.1.
###v1.21.0 (2019-09-24) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.25.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.18.2.
###v1.20.1 (2019-08-15) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.44.2. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.18.1.
###v1.20.0 (2019-08-10) - Upgraded Filezilla to version 3.44.1. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.18.0.

###v1.18.0 (2019-05-09) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.42.1. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.16.0.
###v1.17.3 (2019-04-25) - Now using baseimage v3.5.2, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Fixed issue where the container could have a zombie process. - Fixed issue where the password would not be submitted when pressing the enter key in the password modal. - Use relative path for favicon ressources to be more friendly with reverse proxy senarios.
###v1.17.2 (2019-03-18) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.41.2.
###v1.17.1 (2019-03-07) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.41.1.
###v1.17.0 (2019-03-06) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.41.0.
###v1.16.0 (2019-01-26) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.40.0.
###v1.15.0 (2018-11-30) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.39.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.15.1.
###v1.14.1 (2018-10-29) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.38.1.
###v1.14.0 (2018-10-26) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.38.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.15.0. - Switched to the Adwaita GTK theme.
###v1.13.2 (2018-10-04) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.37.4. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.14.0.
###v1.13.1 (2018-09-21) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.37.1. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.13.2.
###v1.13.0 (2018-09-18) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.37.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.13.1. - Now using baseimage v3.5.1, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes.
###v1.12.0 (2018-08-27) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.36.0.
###v1.11.2 (2018-08-06) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.35.2.
###v1.11.1 (2018-07-23) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.35.1.
###v1.11.0 (2018-07-23) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.35.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.13.0. - Now using baseimage v3.4.0, which is based on Alpine Linux 3.8.
###v1.10.2 (2018-06-18) - Now using baseimage v3.3.6, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - Upgraded s6-overlay to version 1.21.4.0. - Wait for a limited time when terminating a service. - Set and create the XDG_RUNTIME_DIR directory.
###v1.10.1 (2018-06-18) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.34.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.12.3.
###v1.10.0 (2018-05-08) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.33.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.12.2.
###v1.9.0 (2018-04-03) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.32.0. - Switched to a baseimage based on Alpine Linux 3.7.
###v1.8.1 (2018-03-02) - Now using baseimage v3.3.4, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - Make sure the log monitor is started after the X server. - Fixed an issue where the log monitor `yad` target would use XDG folders of the application. - Fixed issue where log monitor states were not cleared during container startup.
###v1.8.0 (2018-02-25) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.31.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.12.1.
###v1.7.2 (2018-02-03) - Now using baseimage v3.3.2, which brings the following changes: - Restored timezone support in Alpine Linux images with glibc. - Fixed issue in `add-pkg` helper where a package could be incorrectly detected as installed.
###v1.7.1 (2018-01-30) - Now using baseimage v3.3.1, which brings the following changes: - Adjusted the way some ressources are accessed to better support reverse proxy to the container.
###v1.7.0 (2018-01-22) - Now using baseimage v3.3.0, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - For Alpine Linux images with glibc, automatically update dynamic linker's cache after new libraries are installed. - Fixed the LANG environment variable not being set properly. - Added the ability to automatically install a CJK (Chinese/Japanese/Korean) font.
###v1.6.1 (2018-01-11) - Now using baseimage v3.2.2, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.2. - Upgraded glibc to version 2.26 (Alpine Linux glibc images). - Adjusted the way ownership of /config is taken to better support cases where the folder is mapped to a network share. - Small adjustment to the way ownership of files are taken.
###v1.6.0 (2018-01-08) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.30.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.11.2.
###v1.5.2 (2017-12-12) - Now using baseimage v3.1.4, which brings the following changes: - Set 2 worker processes for nginx.
###v1.5.1 (2017-11-20) - Now using baseimage v3.1.3, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.1.
###v1.5.0 (2017-11-06) - Now using baseimage v3.1.2, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Fixed an issue where a self-disabled service could be restarted. - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.0. - Use a more efficient way to monitor status files. - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.29.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.11.1.
###v1.4.0 (2017-10-29) - Now using baseimage v3.1.0, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.1.1. - Enhanced integration of service dependencies functionality. - Added a simple log monitor. - Fixed race condition where container's exit code would not be the expected one. - Fixed issue where application's GUI fails to displayed when accessing it through the web interface via standard ports 80/443.
###v1.3.4 (2017-10-11) - Reduced size of the container image.
###v1.3.3 (2017-10-11) - Fixed assert seen when starting FileZilla.
###v1.3.2 (2017-10-09) - Now using baseimage v3.0.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed issue where nginx config change was not applied correctly on systems without IPV6 support and secure connection disabled.
###v1.3.1 (2017-10-08) - Now using baseimage v3.0.1, which brings the following changes: - Fixed nginx config for systems without IPV6 support.
###v1.3.0 (2017-10-07) - Now using baseimage v3.0.0, which brings the following changes: - Better support for service dependencies. - Added support for secure access to the application's GUI.
###v1.2.0 (2017-09-29) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.28.0. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.11.0. - Now using baseimage v2.0.9, which brings the following changes: - Restore default `/etc/shadow` during container startup.
###v1.1.4 (2017-09-08) - Now using baseimage v2.0.8, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Fixed timezone support on alpine-glibc images. - Fixed duplicated entries in /etc/passwd and /etc/group that were created after a restart of the container.
###v1.1.3 (2017-08-14) - Upgraded FileZilla to version 3.27.1. - Upgraded libfilezilla to version 0.10.1.
###v1.1.2 (2017-08-14) - Now using baseimage v2.0.6, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.20.0.0.
###v1.1.1 (2017-08-03) - Changed the editor to gvim.
###v1.1.0 (2017-07-31) - FileZilla does not support being terminated with signals. So when the container is stopped, try closing FileZilla by simulating ctrl+q key presses. This allows FileZilla to save all its configuration files. - Fixed error with host keys saving. - Create required directories. - Added text editor to allow editing files from FileZilla.
###v1.0.1 (2017-07-31) - Now using baseimage v2.0.5, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Clear the environment of the container during startup. - Clear the /tmp folder during startup. - Cleanly terminate the X server when container is restarted/stopped. - Improved robustness of X server starting process. - Removed unneeded files from the image.
###v1.0.0 (2017-07-28) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI. Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated. This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup. Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes. GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

Config.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
Config.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

Config.Name: Install Packages
Config.Description: Space-separated list of Alpine Linux packages to install. See <i>https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org</i> for the list of available Alpine Linux packages.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>. For other network types, port 5800 should be used instead.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>. For other network types, port 5900 should be used instead.
